meanings.definition: A soft white limestone used for writing or drawing.
meanings.sent1: The teacher wrote on the blackboard with chalk.
meanings.sent2: I picked up a piece of chalk to draw on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student replaced the teacher's chalk with colored chalk.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as clear as if written in chalk on a blackboard.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands were dusted with chalk after a day of drawing.

meanings.definition: A piece of chalk used for writing or drawing.
meanings.sent1: She held the chalk firmly in her hand to write her name.
meanings.sent2: The children used up all the chalk during their drawing session.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a never-ending string of chalk from his pocket.
meanings.sent4: His ideas flowed onto the paper like chalk on a canvas.
meanings.sent5: The sidewalk was covered in colorful chalk drawings after the festival.

meanings.definition: To mark or write with chalk.
meanings.sent1: He chalked the outline of the hopscotch game on the pavement.
meanings.sent2: She carefully chalked the measurements on the wall before cutting.
meanings.sent3: The detective chalked the outline of the body on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day are chalked vividly in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The athlete chalked his hands before attempting the climb.
